name: Plumbing Essentials
description: Prevent leaks and maintain water flow.

templates.name: Flush Water Heater
templates.description: Remove sediment buildup to extend heater life and efficiency.
instructions: Turn off power (electric) or set to pilot (gas).
Connect a garden hose to the drain valve.
Run the other end of the hose to a floor drain or outside.
Open the drain valve and let water run until clear.
Close valve, disconnect hose, and restore power/gas.
safetyPrecautions: Water will be scalding hot. Use caution.

templates.name: Check Under-Sink Plumbing
templates.description: Inspect for small leaks that cause cabinet damage.
instructions: Clear items from under kitchen and bathroom sinks.
Run water and check P-traps and supply lines for drips.
Feel the bottom of the cabinet for moisture or warping.
Tighten any loose fittings by hand.

templates.name: Test Sump Pump
templates.description: Ensure sump pump is ready for heavy rain.
instructions: Pour a bucket of water into the sump pit.
Verify the float rises and the pump activates.
Listen for strange noises.
Check the discharge pipe outlet outside to ensure water flows freely.
safetyPrecautions: Ensure pump is plugged into a GFCI outlet.

name: Electrical Safety
description: Critical checks to prevent electrical fires and shocks.

templates.name: Test GFCI Outlets
templates.description: Verify ground fault protection in wet areas.
instructions: Press the 'TEST' button on the outlet (power should cut off).
Plug in a lamp to confirm power is off.
Press the 'RESET' button to restore power.
If outlet fails to trip or reset, replace immediately.

templates.name: Inspect Breaker Panel
templates.description: Visual check for signs of overheating or corrosion.
instructions: Open the panel door.
Look for rust, scorch marks, or buzzing sounds.
Do not touch any wires or breakers.
Ensure the panel is accessible and not blocked by storage.
safetyPrecautions: Do not remove the panel cover.
Call an electrician if you see damage.
